security: Revealing that Veciana was registered to LNGLUE and employed with the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) in La Paz, Bolivia, from April 1968 to June 30, 1972. "ISR registered VECIANA to LNGLUE NOVEMBER 1962 AND RECORD SHOWS HE TERMINATED WITHOUT PREJUDICE JULY 1966. Y. EMPLOYED WITH OFFICER OF CAPITAL DEVELOPMENT U.S. AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (AID), LA PAZ, BOLIVIA, CIRCA APRIL 1968 TO JUNE 30, 1972. Y"
summary: This cable discusses traces on Antonio Carlos Veciana Blanch, founder of Alpha 66, and his connections to various organizations and U.S. agencies.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated June 7, 1974, details the background of Antonio Carlos Veciana Blanch, the founder of Alpha 66, and his prior involvement with the People's Revolutionary Movement in Cuba. It mentions Veciana granting a Power of Attorney to use the Revolutionary Movement of People (MRP) in 1962, his registration to LNGLUE, and his employment with the U.S. Agency for International Development (AID) in La Paz, Bolivia, from 1968 to 1972. The cable references file 201-312966, noting Veciana was mentioned and denounced as a CIA agent.
title: Traces on Antonio Carlos Veciana Blanch
